head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 30/5/73 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acquaint you, that I have received a few days ago from Dr Eichler, Director of the bot Garden of Kiel, two (2) large folio-volumes of his ...

div.p: J73/10424, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to acquaint you, that I have received a few days ago from Dr Eichler, Director of the bot Garden of Kiel, two (2) large folio-volumes of his work on Brazilian plants, largely illustrated. In return it would be recommendable to send to the Director at Kiel such of my own works, as are available in the Gov. Printing office, by which means the reciprocity will be maintained and Dr Eichler's future volumes be secured. I therefore beg to submit a requisition formally for your favorable consideration. I also beg to advise, that he may receive a collection of Australian seeds for such other kinds of seeds as are here required from the bot Garden of Kiel.
I have the honor to be, Sir, your obedient servant

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the Minister of the Lands Department
On 9 June 1873 the Secretary of Lands, A. Wallis, minuted: 'I assume there can be no objection to the sanction of the within request.' Hodgkinson added a comment but it is illegible.
